title: To Kill A Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Book About Family, Law and Father's Love

title: Go Set a Watchman
author: Harper Lee
description: A sequel to 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' it continues the story of Scout Finch as an adult, addressing her perspectives on racial tensions and personal values.

title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
author: Betty Smith
description: This coming-of-age novel follows a young girl, Francie Nolan, growing up in Brooklyn in the early 20th century, dealing with poverty and striving for a better life.

title: The Secret Life of Bees
author: Sue Monk Kidd
description: Set in South Carolina in 1964, the story follows a young girl, Lily Owens, who escapes her troubled life by running away to live with a trio of African American beekeepers.

title: Cry, the Beloved Country
author: Alan Paton
description: Set in South Africa, this novel deals with racial injustice and social change, following a black priest's search for his son in Johannesburg.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The story of the Joad family, who are displaced from their Oklahoma farm during the Great Depression and travel to California in search of a better life, highlighting issues of poverty and injustice.

title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
author: Maya Angelou
description: An autobiography that covers the early years of the author, dealing with themes of racism, identity, and resilience.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A powerful story about a runaway slave and the haunting legacy of slavery, exploring themes of motherhood, memory, and identity.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A classic novel that addresses themes of race and identity through the journey of a young boy and a runaway slave traveling down the Mississippi River.

title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
author: Zora Neale Hurston
description: This novel follows Janie Crawford, an African American woman in the early 20th century, as she searches for her own identity and independence through three marriages and personal struggles.
